info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 3:48AM PDT until August 21 at 6:30AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM PDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN CLARK COUNTY... At 348 AM PDT, Moderate to heavy rain persists in the Spring Mountains early this morning, with six hour rainfall totals of 1 to 3 inches estimated in Lee and Kyle Canyons. Significant flooding is ongoing within Rainbow, Kyle, and Lee Canyons...with Mt Charleston Fire reporting minor infrastructure damage in the area and some washed out or impassable roadways. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Las Vegas, Rainbow Canyon, Spring Mountains, Mt. Charleston, Red Rock Canyon, Summerlin, Blue Diamond, Kyle Canyon Campground, Fletcher View Campground, Lovell Canyon Campground, Rocky Gap Campground, Hilltop Campground, Mahogany Grove Campground, Mary Jane Falls Campground, Dolomite Campground, Mcwilliams Campground, Red Rock Canyon Campground, Spring Mountain Ranch, Mountain Springs and Mt. Potosi. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
